# Introduction

The central problem in estimation theory is that given a vector of observations $\bm{y} = [y_1, y_2,\cdots , y_N]$ that depends on the parameter vector$\bm{\theta} = [\theta_1, \theta_2,\cdots, \theta_N$\], determine $\bm{\theta}$ using some function of $\bm{y}$. Mathematically,

$$
\bm{\hat{\theta}} = g(\bm{y} )
$$
